Package test.java.warzone.services.impl

Class OrderIssuanceServiceImplTest

java.lang.Object
test.java.warzone.services.impl.OrderIssuanceServiceImplTest
public class OrderIssuanceServiceImplTest extends Object
Tests the OrderIssuanceServiceImpl for handling the issue order phase in the game. It verifies that orders can be issued to players without throwing exceptions, ensuring the game phase transitions smoothly. This class sets up a minimal game environment and assesses the service's capability to process user commands for issuing orders.
Version:
2.0.0

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    OrderIssuanceServiceImplTest()
    Initializes the OrderIssuanceServiceImpl and a fresh game session instance for testing.

    cleanUp()
    Cleans up the game session by clearing any existing data after each test, ensuring a clean state for subsequent tests.

    Prepares the game environment before each test by resetting the game session and setting up a basic game world structure with continents, countries, and neighbors.
    void
    testOrderIssueHandling()
    Verifies that the ISSUE_ORDERS phase can be handled without any exceptions being thrown, ensuring the order issuance process is functioning as expected.

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      @BeforeEach public void setUp() throws WarzoneValidationException
      Prepares the game environment before each test by resetting the game session and setting up a basic game world structure with continents, countries, and neighbors.
      Throws:
      WarzoneValidationException - If setup fails due to invalid game world configuration.

    • testOrderIssueHandling

      @Test public void testOrderIssueHandling()
      Verifies that the ISSUE_ORDERS phase can be handled without any exceptions being thrown, ensuring the order issuance process is functioning as expected.

    • cleanUp

      @AfterEach public void cleanUp()
      Cleans up the game session by clearing any existing data after each test, ensuring a clean state for subsequent tests.
